text:
Alright, then. Seein' as we've got the time,
wanna tell the rest of us about you and
your buddy Sephiroth?
It all started five years ago. Was sixteen at the time.
There was hardly any work for SOLDIERs back then─and what little there was...was boring as hell. My heart wasn't in it.
Then, outta nowhere, the job of a lifetime came up.

Wish I could help, but never been motion sick.
Sorry, man.
I'd like to be briefed on the mission at some point.

'Cause if it's another one of those Turks gigs,
you can let me off right here.
Finally make First, and what do they do? Call a cease-fire with Wutai, stealin' my shot at glory.
I didn't join SOLDIER to be an errand boy.
I joined up so I could be a hero like you.
Well, our mission is to survey a run-down reactor.
Another one of those Turks gigs.
Ugh, fine... Job's a job, I guess.
Nibelheim? That's where I grew up.
Got some fiends at our twelve!
You take one, I'll take the other.
He was in a different league from the rest of us.
Nibelheim... That's where they built the first reactor.
It all started in the fall.

Something was wrong with the reactor,
and the whole village was up in arms.
Talk of strange new monsters on the mountain only made things worse.

The villagers tried to take care of the monsters themselves, but it was no good.
Ended up calling Shinra.
So the company sent help─best they had.
Tell me, how does it feel?
I have no home, so I wouldn't know.
You still got parents though, right?
She died shortly after I was born.
Why am I talking about this?
Hope I didn't keep you waiting!
I wanted to greet you myself─to welcome you to our humble little town!
Consider yourself off duty till sundown.

So, any friends here you wanna see?
Maybe a girlfriend?
Speaking of which, I'll bet you're dying to hear about mine. Am I right?
"Backwater" is an understatement... Don't blame you for gettin' the hell outta here.
Uh, hey. We got a job to do, in case you forgot?
C'mon, eyes on the prize, buddy. We ain't done here yet.
Look at all this mud. It's never gonna come off.
Oh, I'll be telling everyone how I welcomed the great Sephiroth to town till the day I die!
Would kill for a shot of him...but I should prob'ly wait till later, huh?
Sephiroth's at the inn. I tried to sneak a shot of him, but my hands were shaking!
You want me to take your photo?
Sorry, but I can't afford to waste my film on, uh...who are you again?
Mind asking Sephiroth to come out?
Shinra's here, I see. Thank you for coming.
I didn't recognize you, Cloud. How you've grown.
I must say, you look dashing in that uniform.
You just... You look so different.
Then I stopped by my mom's─not that it matters.
Sure it does! I know I wanna hear what happened.
My dad died when I was a kid, so after I left for Midgar, she was on her own.

Was the first time we'd seen each other
in two years.
Let me get a good look at you!

My, my...
So that's what they've got you wearing, huh?
You SOLDIERs sure do clean up nice!
Women must be hounding you day and night.

You know, there's all kinds of
temptations in the big city.
I'd feel a lot better if I knew you'd found a good girl─one who'd make sure you didn't get into trouble.
I can take care of myself.
An older, more mature girl that could keep you on the straight and narrow─and tell you when you're being a silly goose.
That's the perfect type for you, I'd say.
They are feeding you properly, aren't they?
You're my son. Of course I'll always be─
No, I was making a joke.
If that's your idea of a joke, I'm not laughing.
C'mon, Cloud. I know you're better than this.
Wow... Where'd you learn to do that?
Hey! You gotta play for us sometime!
Well, shit. You're a merc of many talents.
You could've just left it alone, you know.
Yeah, uh, don't quit your day job.
Wait a second. You two were neighbors?
We were, but...it's not like we hung out that much.

"Our" reasons, huh?
Bet most of 'em had to do with you.
So, how did it feel being back up there?

I don't know─nostalgic, I guess?
After two years away and all that.
"Weak legs betray a weak mind." Heh... Takes me back.
Ah, hello there. All our rooms are reserved for you Shinra boys, so take your pick.
My my, get a load of you! And you've only been away a couple of years!
Traveling with the Sephiroth now? Okay, Mr. Big Shot!
Welcome back! Sephiroth's already gone upstairs.
A humble traveler of the world, and teacher of martial arts to the youth.
Well-toned, but lacking mass. You need to bulk up.
You could learn a lot from me.
Don't be shy. I have many pupils your age.
At last count...one hundred and twenty-eight.
In fact, one of them's from this very village.
A real talent, that one. She'll go far.

I'd be interested to see
how one of Shinra's finest fights.
Should you need my help, just say the word.
I've been working on some new techniques.
Haha! I need but one look, people of Nibelheim, to see that you lead happy, healthy lives.
As the creator of Zanga-cise, I couldn't be more proud. And you should be too, considering the strides you've made.
Yet ours is a never-ending journey of self-improvment. We must press on!
So allow me─Rashard Zangan─to lead you all today.
And where better to begin than with pose one: the Seraph. Are...you...
Lift your arms straight up and reach for the sky!
Press your arms to your ears...and show me your palms.
Keep those fingers straight─all the way to their tips.
Now picture an angel descending from the heavens. Imagine her reaching down and gently clasping both your wrists.
Feel her lifting you higher and higher...
That's right. Just a little further... You can almost touch the clouds!
She's got you on your tiptoes. The stars are in reach!
Hnnn...whewww... Slow breaths now. And after counting to ten...shake, shake, shake it all out.
Pose two: the Stone Bird. Ready? Let's...
Lift both hands straight up... Arms to your ears.
Just like that. Keep those palms facing me! Now bend your right knee...and lift it...
Focus on your core, now. Don't let your legs do all the work.
Extend your foot... Like the heron in the river poised to take a step.
Hold it there... Become as immutable as a statue!
Don't forget to breathe. First, breathe out...and in...
Beat them with effortless grace. Take to the sky and fly into the sunset.
Remember: visualization is key to achieving results.
Hnnn...hahhh... Count to ten...and shake, shake, shake...
You're doing well. Now let's finish strong!
It's time to assume our final pose: the Scales of Justice. Let's...
Arms in the air once more! Squeeze them tight against your ears!
Next, slowly lower and spread your arms wide...until they're parallel to the ground. Now bend your left knee and slowly lift your leg, while focusing on your thighs and core.
Keep those arms straight and balanced like a scale. Now stretch!
Now close your eyes...and feel the angel wings that have sprouted from your shoulder blades. Take to the sky with them and ride the wind!
Imagine flying to the house of a faraway friend.
Treat them to a hearty greeting. "Long time no see!"
And of course, remember to smile! ...Once you count to ten...shake, shake, shake it all out!
Let's take a short break. The body needs time to recover from its adventures.
Would you care to join us?
Every pupil of mine must first master these stretches.
The secret to a fruitful workout is a vivid imagination.
But looking back, all the signs were there. From the moment we arrived, Sephiroth just wasn't himself.
I could swear I've seen it before.
Big day tomorrow. We'll be leaving bright and early.

I tried, but I couldn't get to sleep that night.
Was too excited─too...nervous.
Was pretty much the same for me...
We leave once our guide arrives.

Sephiroth, sir, I must insist that
I take you up the mountain.
You can still back out. You don't have to do this.
There'll be two SOLDIERs with me. I'll be fine!
Good morning, sir! I'll be your guide for the day.

You can ask anyone around here.
I'm the best there is.
Not if you remember to do your job, she won't.
Please, Sephiroth? It'd mean a lot to us.
C'mon, where's the harm in that?
Sounds like you were havin' a good time.
Yeah... I guess we were. For a while.
The reactor was halfway up Mt. Nibel.
I was looking forward to breathing that crisp, clean mountain air again.
You prob'ly already know this, but our reactor's the first of its kind. It really put Mt. Nibel on the map.
I've seen a few reactors in my time, but none with such a breathtaking view.

Man, I wish I could go on trips
all over the world like you guys...

I think you mean "business trips"─
which are no fun at all.
Though you do learn stuff on 'em.
Everything okay? Not goin' too fast for you, am I?
'Course not. We're just tryin' to pace ourselves is all.
But I thought you guys were in a hurry.
Even so─you'll burn yourself out runnin' like that.
I'm not even close to burned out.
Not with all the training I've had.
Huh. Guess you really are "the best there is."
Seen those near the village, and they're not nice.
If this is how it's going to be, there doesn't seem much point in me fighting.
I...guess not! You leave it all to me, huh?
You know what to do, Cloud!

Come on, SOLDIER.
You can do better than that, can't you?
We still have a long way to go.
Shall we pick up the pace?

Not unless we absolutely have to.
Our guide might not be so lucky next time.

Then...how 'bout I go on ahead
and clear the way for you guys?
Cool. See ya at the reactor.

It's a dead end.
Rockslide took out the bridge a while ago.
Gotta make a detour through a Shinra facility.
To think I almost made you our guide.
Good thing I reconsidered. Otherwise, you'd have led us straight off a cliff.
The reactor may have been around for a while, but there are still pockets of mako gas all over the mountain.
Try not to breathe it in if you can.

Elevator access restricted due to
mako gas concentrations.

Air purification unit must be employed
to clear excess mako gas.
No mako gas detected. Elevator access granted.
Just thinking about crossing that thing...
Following the river should get us back to the village.

We're not going to the village.
Can you get us to the reactor?
Sorry, I...I don't think I can.

Well, we certainly can't send you back alone.
You'll be safer with us.
I'll be joining you up front this time.

There's no way around it, either.
Just have to go through.

Let's not waste any time.
Mako this thick is dangerous.
Yeah, but if we keep using mako to power our homes, springs like this will disappear, right?
What're you talking about? Who told you that?
And the mayor, if you must know.
'Cept the planet's huge. Mako will never run out.
And look at the size of it. Astounding.

For the mako energy to condense into something
like this, it must have taken an eternity.
I've always wondered: how does materia let you cast spells exactly?
How did you ever get to be a SOLDIER?
To put it simply, the knowledge of the Ancients is sealed within each orb.
That knowledge not only connects us to the planet...
it allows us to tap into her power. That's how we can use magic, or so they say.

I know someone who'd be livid to hear you call it "weird"─or "magic," for that matter.
I can just imagine what he'd say.

Hojo from Research & Development.
His predecessor was a great man, but him?

Elevator access restricted due to
mako gas concentrations.

Air purification unit must be employed
to clear excess mako gas.
No mako gas detected. Elevator access granted.
Up ahead! Looks like a way out!
You said you wanted to be a hero.

but everything you've said makes Sephiroth
sound like a stand-up guy.

And now he's pure evil─
tryin' to kill everyone on the planet.
Help me to understand this shit. Tell me something that'll really make my blood boil!
Sorry, no civilians─even if we weren't on a mission.
I really wanted to see the reactor...
Would it kill this guy to say something?
Didn't expect it to be "all systems go."

You'd think it'd be running at reduced output,
like most last-gen models.

And lemme guess─villagers
don't have a clue about this?
The company really needs to be more transparent.
What exactly is the problem with this place?
The people in charge. While most reactors are under the jurisdiction of Urban Planning, this one is overseen by R&D.

Huh. Why do I suddenly have
a bad feeling about this?
Whatever you see here, you're not to speak of it.

Perhaps you'd like to say a few words
to your sword first?

The malfunction must be forcing
the pods to depressurize.
Cloud. Go out and shut off the valve.

These pods were built for the production
of artificial materia.

But Hojo repurposed them as incubators─
cages for animals─infused with mako.
All to birth a new breed of monster.

But he didn't stop at animals...oh no.
There were other subjects.
Am I the same as these monsters?
Ever since I was a child, I knew...
I knew that I was different. That I...was special.
Eventually, we went back to the inn.

But when we got there...
Sephiroth locked himself in his room.
The mayor had been looking forward to having dinner with "bona fide SOLDIERs," so he didn't take the news too well.

Dad had to put up with his bellyaching
for hours afterward.

Musta sucked, but what about Sephiroth?
What happened to him?
He left. Didn't tell a soul where he was going.

Hm? Sephiroth?
Ah, I did see him leave a little while ago.
Don't know what bee got in his bonnet, but the man was not in a good mood.
Looking for Sephiroth? He just left, I'm afraid... Maybe he needed some fresh air?
So, how was the reactor? Did you find out what was wrong with it?
I met Sephiroth as he was heading for Shinra Manor, and he acted like I wasn't even there.
Haven't heard anything about the reactor either. What happened up there anyway?
I saw Sephiroth making a beeline for the manor. Wonder why.
While I got you: any chance you could convince him to autograph that photo I took?

Shinra Manor was the biggest building in town.
And older than the reactor.
The company used to conduct research there, back when they were still a small manufacturer.
Even so, the rent on that plot was basically what kept the village afloat.
Took a look around the place...but Sephiroth was nowhere to be seen.

Was news to me too.
Doubt anyone in the village had a clue.

Excavated from a 2,000-year-old rock layer.
A life-form in stasis.
And once they understood what she was...

And that was it.
He stayed holed up in the basement...

Racking my brain's not gonna get me anywhere.
May as well just ask the guy.

Ah, Cloud.
I've come across the most fascinating passage.
"The specimen, found in strata dating back two thousand years, smiled with what could only be described as 'ethereal grace.'
"Though the truth eluded me at first, I later determined that she was an Ancient─or a 'steward of the planet,' as they are referred to in legend.
"She needed a name...and so I dubbed her 'Jenova.'"

The Jenova Project was approved soon after─
a bold initiative to resurrect the long-dead Ancients.
An initiative...that resulted in my conception.
Or rather, my creation! The crowning glory of Professor Gast's wondrous experiment!
I should go. Mother is waiting.

I keep asking myself...
"Why couldn't I have come to sooner?"
If I had...maybe I coulda saved the village.
Get in there! The villagers need your help!
Let me through! My son's still in there!
Is it true? Sephiroth did this!?
Oh, it was him alright! And he's still here! So keep your eyes peeled!
Get your heads straight! I need you to secure the way out. Now!
You have to leave... You have to live.
Hang in there! You're gonna be okay!
You sick son of a bitch!
I followed Sephiroth all the way back to the reactor.
Dad and I had gone there to hide.

When Sephiroth showed up, Dad decided that
he was going to confront him.
It was Sephiroth, wasn't it? He did this, didn't he!?
I'm sick of all of this!
Now, open the way for me.
Mother, I have come for you.
You murdered my dad... You burned my village!

You promised you'd save me...
if I was ever...trapped...or in trouble...
Mother, together we will reclaim our world.
And I know exactly how we can do that.
The ones who robbed you of the planet...your planet.

But there's no need to be sad, Mother.
Because I'm here for you─now and forever.
You killed my mom! You killed Tifa!
This planet too, for I have been chosen.
Not you─whoever the hell you are!

Uh, Cait? Meant to tell you before,
but the terminal's prob'ly gone.
Nibelheim burned down five years ago.
It did, aye... Not to worry, though. The terminal's as snug as a bug in a rug.
'Cause Shinra wasnae about to let that facility burn down.
but what I do know is that it's the only lead we have on that materia.
Yeah. It's this or nothing. We should get going.
Didn't seem worth coming back till now. Didn't think there was anything to come back to.
It's alright. Lot's happened since then.
I'll see ya when I see ya!

Looks like we're not the only ones
headed for Nibelheim.
Huh... Almost like they swung by Cosmo Canyon just so they could lead us here.
Sorry, just thinking out loud. Forget about it.
Uh... Cloud? Stay close, would you?
I honestly thought I was ready for this, but...

Don't scare me like that.
Thought Cloud might've lost it ag─

I mean, I thought he got us lost.
'Cause it looks different.
So...who do you think rebuilt it?
Never mind all that─we've got a terminal to find!
Only they aren't quite the same, are they?
Hello there. Can I help you?
I am a proud employee of Shinra Resorts.
And since I was nearby, I thought I might pop in and check something on the company database.
I used to live here. Until...you know.
And are you aware of what Nibelheim is now?

Five years ago, Shinra assumed direct control
over this village.

It now serves as a treatment center
for mako poisoning.
All property rights have been transferred.
If that's why you're here, contact Special Facilities at corporate. They'll be able to help you.
Ah, but the database. I'll not be a wee minute!

I'm sure you're eager to see your hometown,
but please, don't stay too long.
It totally screams "climb me," doesn't it?

So, let's give the poor thing what it wants
and see the sights!
To look at this place...you'd never know...
I'm sorry. I shouldn't have said that.
Nah, don't worry about it. It's all new to you.

That building right there is the inn...
where I stayed five years ago.
So lemme guess. This is where you kept lookout?
C'mon, you never came up here hopin' she'd wave?
"You never came up here hopin' she'd wave?"
Prob'ly. Sounds like something I'd do.

If I was in your shoes?
I woulda been up here all the time.
What? N-no way. I-I'd never do that.
Wasn't trying to be. Honestly. Just wanted to know.
Think I'm good where I am. I'll see ya later.
If you don't mind, I'd like to be alone.
To have a friend you've known since you were a kid. Someone you can say "Remember the time when...?" to. Someone you can reminisce with.
I don't have anyone like that...and it feels like I'm being taunted for it. Which stings─more than it should.
That is why I wanna be alone.
Plus, I might take it out on you, and I don't want that.
Well I do. And it'd only make me feel worse.
I'll be down in a bit. See you then.

Fresh air... Peace and quiet...
Not a bad place to grow up.
I know it's not the village you knew...but it's still nice.
I never understood it. Why'd my dad go into the reactor? Why chase Sephiroth?

Thought about it ever since waking up in Corel.
It just seemed liked such a bad idea.

I mean, what did he think he was gonna do?
Fight a famous war hero and win?
But after moving to Midgar...after making a life for myself, I finally realized where my dad was coming from.
He was angry. And he'd had enough.
Everything he'd worked so hard for had been destroyed in an instant.

All that he'd built for himself, for us─gone.
Sephiroth had burned it to the ground.
That's why he went─even though he had to have known how it'd end.
And like him, I took my pain, my grief─everything I was feeling...

I took it all and turned it into anger.
Anger that led me to Avalanche.
The problem is... Anger doesn't last.
So when Avalanche started to become more violent, there wasn't enough left to hold back the fear and the doubt.
It was taking a toll... Then you turned up.
"It was taking a toll... Then you turned up."
Have I helped you get through it at all?
Have I helped you get through it at all?
Yeah, you have. If it wasn't for you, I wouldn't have had the courage to come back here.

A lot's happened, but─now that we're here─
I know this was the right decision.
Because now I know they rebuilt everything─tried to sweep what they did under the rug and pretend it never even happened.
But I won't let them. I can't.

Sephiroth and his cruelty...Shinra and their lies...
I'm sick of all of it.
Hey, remember when we were kids? How you'd─you know─always be looking at me?
Every time we made eye contact, you'd look away. And when I tried to talk to you, you'd ignore me.
Not surprised... I was a pain in the ass as a kid.
I was the opposite. I needed everyone to like me, all the time. Part of me still does, I think. Kinda hate that about myself.
Ah, that's right─you're the ones Nick was talkin' about. New in town, aren't you?
In that case, you ought to know better than to interrupt a busy chef, hmm?

No, no, I don't mind.
Could use someone to talk to anyway.
Then again, I sense you're not much of a chatterbox.

La la la laaa laaa...
My cooking's like no other♪

La la la laaa laaa...
Thanks to my dear old mother, god rest her soul♪

They say I'm always gossiping
No secret's safe with me unless I sing♪
Blah de blah blah, blah de blah de blah!♪
Oh, how I love to spill the tea!♪
Now don't you go pickin' on 'em! Those poor folks have got it hard enough already.
Yep. I'm no expert, but seems to me that there's two types of it. Or, maybe...two types of patients?
We give 'em sponge baths sometimes─and that's when I first saw. Lots of 'em have these...number tattoos.
That, and needle marks on their arms. Least I think they are.
Although...we do get the odd one that doesn't seem to have either.
Wait. That makes it three types, then. Or four?
From their treatments, if I had to guess.
And the numbers? Got any idea what they mean?
Not a clue. Certainly gets the gears in your head turnin' though, doesn't it?
As I said, there seem to be two types of those black-robed folks.
Most have these numbers tattooed on 'em somewhere, but a few have what look like needle marks dotting their arms as well.
Of course, there are those that don't have any such oddity on them at all.
Wait─did I say two types just now? Or three? Or four? Or...gah!
Something about that place doesn't sit right with me.
Oh! Sorry... No one wants to hear people badmouth their hometown.

"No one wants to hear people
badmouth their hometown."
I never liked that place either.
Yeah, does kinda make you feel like shit.

This isn't my hometown.
Not the one I grew up in, anyway.
Wonder why they'd go through the trouble of rebuilding it...
Hey, I'm with you. Never liked that place. Just looking at it gives me the creeps.
Hopefully the company's not using it anymore...
Yeah, does kinda make you feel like shit.
I keep asking myself "What could Shinra want with all these robed guys?"
Ah, come to think of it, it's kinda rude we keep calling them "robed guys" and stuff. They've got names, right?
You don't really think that all these guys decided to get up and shuffle over here of their own accord, do you?
First they raze a whole village 'cause it suits 'em, then they build a fake one right on top of it...
We can't let those corporate bastards keep gettin' away with this shit! We gotta do something, right!?
Hell yeah you're right. Screw them.
I wanna know why they put the robes here.
Hell yeah you're right. Screw them.
That's the spirit─screw 'em! We'll make 'em pay for what they did to y'all's home.
I just wanna know what they're rounding 'em up for.
The hell if I know... Nothin' good, though.
That shit right there is how they managed to take over the world.
They make you beat yourself! They keep tellin' you you're powerless, and eventually you start believin' it.
These boys're lucky they got us lookin' out for 'em. If Shinra tries anything, I'll make sure they don't succeed.
Listen, Cloud... I don't know what went down five years ago, but...I'm here for you and Tifa. Whatever you need.
If it's too much, just say the word. We'll leave.

So, any friends here you wanna see?
Maybe a girlfriend?
Speaking of which, I'll bet you're dying to hear about mine. Am I right?

From Gongaga. Head over heels for Aerith.
We fought together as SOLDIERs...

You were here with me five years ago.
You came with me on the mission.
Where are you? What happened to you?
Looks like the reactor's not too far... Hey, Cloud. Ever been up there before?
Oho? Then gimme the skinny! What was it like? Was there buttloads of mako?
Yup. Some of 'em even formed naturally.

No. Way. "Naturally"!?
Oh man, ya got my mouth waterin'!
Guess it's true what they say... If you want somethin' done right, you really do gotta do it yourself!

Uh-huh, nice try, but you can't fool me.
I know what you're up to!
You want it all for yourself!
What are we waitin' for? That materia needs me!
So, what's the story here, exactly?
Because for a cat, he has an awfully high level of clearance. It's more than a little suspicious.
No "average employee" should be able to access what he can.
I understand this must be confusing for you, but I don't know anything either.
I just go where the company tells me. That's it.
Gonna need a smidge more time.
Why not visit some of your old haunts while you have the chance?
You never know, you might remember somethin' nice...

I shoulda known it was too good to be true...
I only have limited access from this console.
Excuse me, good sir! Would you be so kind as to grant us entry into Shinra Manor?
Oh, if only! I'm but a wee bottom-feeder.
Barely have clearance to use the bathroom, me!
Be that as it may, I can't let you in there myself. You'll have to ask my boss instead.

Meaning the deputy commissioner?
Or...the commish himself?
Deputy Commissioner Murasaki's up at the reactor─conducting an inspection for corporate.
He's due back the day after tomorrow, but...he hasn't been in touch to confirm.
Could be he needs more time.
Ach, we cannae afford to dillydally!
Then we'll just have to track him down.
Thanks for all the help, pal.
Please, don't tell anyone I let you touch our terminal.
...Get me the hell out of this backwater.
So! You're headed to the reactor, huh?

"Headed to the reactor"?
No luck at town hall, I take it?
Gotta get a keycard. A guy named Murasaki has it, but he's inspecting the reactor.

Well then, you'll need a ninja to accompany you!
I'm comin' with.
"Ask anyone around here. I'm the best there is."
You sure you're gonna be okay?

We're going on a hike and getting a keycard.
How tough can it be?

You'll still be gone for a while.
Sure there's nothin' you need to take care of?

I'm puttin' you in charge of provisions...
but make it snappy! My materia needs me!
We goin' to the reactor or what?
New bridge just went in, you know─might shave some time off the trip!
Sounds like a plan to me! Alright, reactorward ho!

We've received word about the Nibelheim
survey team. It appears they were ambushed.
That the new bridge I see up ahead?
Hey! Keep your eyes on the prize, Cloud!
I remember what happened here. And to Zack.
Bridge broke, he fell. Got swept away by the current. I think he's...

You never forgot, did you?
That's why you've been acting weird.
Didn't wanna upset you. That's all.

Zack was my friend.
